item.title: Creating Ground
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:6, topic:240893”][quote author=ziplock link=topic=317205.msg2517418#msg2517418 date=1225683371]
You can’t do it.
[/quote]Then how the hell does it get there in the first place Zip? ;]

Anyways, that’s why 474’s went out of style, cuz no one could get map data for it. So if a whole community couldn’t find out how to do it, I’d say it’s a lost cause.[/quote]

474’s are coming back.

[quote=“Jordiescape, post:8, topic:240893”][quote author=ziplock link=topic=317205.msg2517418#msg2517418 date=1225683371]
You can do it.
[/quote]
Fixed that up for you ^^. If you can use 508/474 maps on a 317 you can make your own maps, I’m sure their was a tool for it somewhere.[/quote]

Peterbjorn made a tool for working with maps then released a tutorial on how to change the map therefore allowing you to replace the maps in a refactored client such as the 474 with any map you have. At the moment 317 maps are being used on a 474 client made by zee best. It is possible to make new map and add it to your server. After you do that you must find your walkable() method in the server and add that area to it.

ry60003333:

You do know that the create object packet does have a type? For example 10 is normal objects, like fires, trees, rocks. I’m betting that there may be a type for the tiles.

Done client sided. Only in a refactored see above

Read full topic

item.title: Creating Ground
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

You do know that the create object packet does have a type? For example 10 is normal objects, like fires, trees, rocks. I’m betting that there may be a type for the tiles.

Read full topic

item.title: Creating Ground
item.dc:creator: @Sonis Sonis
item.description:
@Sonis wrote:

[quote=“the soul, post:23, topic:240893”][quote author=Sonis link=topic=317205.msg2518333#msg2518333 date=1225751999]
Just to let you guys know, there are areas that are completely black and are also walkable regions …
x=2905 and y=10138

there are loads of more areas that are walkable … I made a city here the other day using the ::object and ::npc commands for fun lolz
[/quote]
There is walkable land that isn’t loaded into the Runescape game, such as features etc. But you still can’t create features such as castles and grass on it.[/quote]
the grass is just objects and details. And that is the same as the rendered height for the terrain i.e. downhill.
You can control where the players feet go and the camera angles with the server. Then that pretty much can make illusions of down and uphill.
Try playing around with the sendFrame commands and it’s really interesting

Read full topic

item.title: Creating Ground
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

[quote=“Sonis, post:22, topic:240893”]Just to let you guys know, there are areas that are completely black and are also walkable regions …
x=2905 and y=10138

there are loads of more areas that are walkable … I made a city here the other day using the ::object and ::npc commands for fun lolz[/quote]
There is walkable land that isn’t loaded into the Runescape game, such as features etc. But you still can’t create features such as castles and grass on it.

Read full topic

and there are object ids that makes ground tiles.
